revised_title: Anatomy and Nervous System of Lumbricus terrestris
tldr: The author examines the anatomy and nervous system of the earthworm, Lumbricus terrestris, focusing on the organs of prehension, deglutition, and digestion. The study reveals the central organs of the nervous system, including a bilobed cephalic ganglion and a double chain of subventral ganglia, which play a crucial role in the digestive apparatus and are connected to various muscles and organs.
